snippet.title: Drilling Fluids, Mud Pumps, and Conditioning Equipment
snippet.description: This series covers the entire scope of rotary drilling operations in five units of technical information and review questions.

snippet.title: Petroleum Engineering Handbook for the Practicing Engineer
snippet.description: The drilling mud circulation is typically routed from the mud pits to the mud pumps, from the mud pump through the standpipe and rotary hose to the drillstring, then down the drillstring to the bit, reversed back up the annulus between the ...

snippet.title: Standard Handbook of Petroleum & Natural Gas Engineering
snippet.description: Mud pumps are used to circulate drilling fluid through the mud circulation system while drilling. A pump with two fluid cylinders, as shown in Figure 4-99, is called a duplex pump. A three-fluid-cylinder pump, as shown in Figure 4-100, is called ...

snippet.description: Mud pumps often have two (duplex) or, more commonly, three (triplex) cylinders with replaceable liners. A duplex pump forces the mud into the discharge line on both the forward and backward strokes of the piston and is called a ...

snippet.title: Standard Handbook of Petroleum and Natural Gas Engineering
snippet.description: 4.4 MUD PUMPS Mud pumps consume more than 60% of all the horsepower used in rotary drilling. Mud pumps are used to circulate drilling fluid through the mud circulation system while drilling. A pump with two fluid cylinders, as shown in ...
